column2: We are FinTech people. We enable financial institutions to become digital leaders.    As a professional team of global scale, we work with best clients for great and exciting projects, in an environment where we learn amazing things every day. Each code, each voice, each contribution, each challenge, each success is celebrated here. We welcome candidates who share our values, have the skills and are  passionate to enjoy our journey to build the digital future of finance, together. About the job: We are looking for a Senior/Principle Cloud Engineer who will be building and managing cloud infrastructures through the utilization of advanced technologies. What you will be doing: Design and build secure, highly scalable, multi-tier, single/multi-tenant cloud infrastructure solutions on platforms such as Azure, AWS, or GCP, aligning them with the company's business objectives. Create and manage the cloud solution infrastructures with infrastructure as code (IAC) tools like Terraform, PowerShell, ARM scripts and automating provisioning and deployment processes with CI/CD solutions such as Azure DevOps. Build fully automated CI/CD pipelines, DevOps processes and improve the existing ones according to the latest technologies and project requirements. Implement and maintain robust security practices, including access controls, encryption, and compliance with industry standards and best practices for VeriPark solutions and projects. Set up monitoring, logging, and alerting systems to proactively identify and resolve issues, ensuring optimal performance and availability. Investigate and resolve complex technical issues related to cloud infrastructure and services, providing root cause analysis and preventive measures. Advise pre-sales & technical teams on best practice architectures for cloud solutions. This can be a reactive response to a customer need or request for proposals and includes participating in proof-of-concepts, making solution demonstrations, presentations, and preparing Azure consumption estimates for the proposed cloud solution architectures. Mentor and lead VeriPark project team members and customers to be proficient in delivering cloud-based solutions.  Identify, build, drive programs and R&D studies to establish new technical practices and learn private or public preview cutting-edge technologies. Document and share designs, technical best practices/insights with internal teams Maintain and advance technical skills and knowledge, keeping up to date with technology trends and competitive insights on cloud and on-prem technologies. There should not be any preventing factor for traveling abroad (0-30%). What we are looking for: 5+ years of relevant working and Microsoft Technologies experience  Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or relevant work experience Experience in building scalable, multi-tier and data-intense systems. Experience in at least one of the following cloud platforms is required, preferably Microsoft Azure. Excellent English skills. What we are offering: Remote Freedom, Your Way:  At VeriPark we believe in the power of talent, no matter where it resides. Design your ideal workspace and achieve the perfect work-life balance. Birthday Leave, Because You Matter:  We value your special moments! Take the day off on your birthday and treat yourself. Global Impact, Cutting-Edge Tech:  Immerse yourself in global projects with top-tier clients and stay ahead with cutting-edge technologies. Your skills will shape the future of our industry. Unleash Your Potential:  Develop yourself with VeriPark Academy opportunities;, webinars, and in-house training sessions. Diverse, Vibrant Community:  Be part of a dynamic environment that values diversity and inclusivity. Together Culture:  Even in a remote world, we cultivate connections through engaging face-to-face gatherings as well as online fun events. Special information sharing environment where you can update & align yourself. Apply now and let's shape the future together! About VeriPark: We are a global technology company with more than two decades of expertise in the Financial Services industry. Our mission is to enable financial institutions to become digital leaders by delivering world class customer journeys in digital and assisted channels. We develop omni-channel delivery, customer engagement (CRM), branch automation and loan origination solutions based on Microsoft technology (Azure, Dynamics 365, Power Platform) for banks and insurance companies worldwide.  With offices in 15 countries from Canada over Europe and the Middle East to Kuala Lumpur, our 900+ colleagues are serving customers in more than 30 countries worldwide.    https://www.veripark.com

column2: We are seeking a skilled and motivated DevOps Architect to join our dynamic IT team.     The ideal candidate will be responsible for collaborating with software developers, system administrators, and other team members to streamline our development and deployment processes.     You will play a key role in automating and optimizing our infrastructure and software delivery pipelines, ensuring reliability, scalability, and efficiency.               Key Responsibilities                 Infrastructure Automation:    Design, implement, and maintain infrastructure as code (IaC) using tools likeTerraform, Ansible, or similar. Automate the provisioning, configuration, and management of servers, databases, and networking components.       Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment (CI/CD):    Develop and enhance CI/CD pipelines for smooth software delivery. Integrate code repositories, build tools, testing frameworks, and deployment mechanisms to achieve automated and reliable releases.       Containerization and Orchestration:    Utilize Docker and Kubernetes to containerize applications and manage their orchestration. Implement and optimize Kubernetes clusters for scalability, high availability, and performance.       Monitoring and Logging:    Implement monitoring solutions to track system performance, availability, and security. Set up log management tools to gather, store, and analyze logs for troubleshooting and insights.       Security and Compliance:    Collaborate with security teams to implement best practices in securing infrastructure and applications. Ensure compliance with industry standards and regulations.       Environment Management:    Maintain development, testing, and production environments, ensuring consistency across different stages of the software development lifecycle.       Collaboration:    Work closely with cross-functional teams to understand their needs and provide technical solutions. Collaborate with software developers to optimize code for deployment and troubleshoot issues.       Scripting and Automation:    Develop scripts and tools to automate routine tasks and processes. Enhance efficiency by eliminating manual interventions wherever possible.       Backup and Recovery:    Design and implement backup and disaster recovery strategies to ensure data integrity and system availability. column2: Visa s Technology Organization   is a community of problem solvers and innovators reshaping the future of commerce.   We operate the world s most sophisticated processing networks capable of handling more than 65k secure transactions a second across 80M merchants,  15k Financial Institutions,  and billions of everyday people.   While working with us you ll get to work on complex distributed systems and solve massive scale problems centered on new payment flows,  business and data solutions,  cyber security,  and B2C platforms.        The Opportunity:      The Middleware Reliability Engineering team is responsible for shared Middleware and Integration infrastructure that supports communication between multiple enterprise applications and business lanes.      This role will be responsible for configuration,  troubleshooting,  Root Cause Analysis,  deployment,  and continuous operational support and improvement of middleware technologies used at Visa,  to make the systems reliable,  scalable and fault tolerant.     The responsibility includes working with Global systems,  Global Operations,  and external Integration partners (Merchants and Acquirers) in implementing solutions via current or proposed middleware/devops technologies,  including but not limited to Web/App Tier,  Caching,  Messaging and Integration Technologies.  He or she must be able to collaborate with others to manage and rationalize incoming requirements to implement appropriate solutions and provide support.       The Work itself:      - Monitor Production environments and work with various teams to resolve Mission Critical issues.      - Provide expert advice and consultation with regards to Application and Web Server configurations (WebSphere Application Server,  Apache,  Tomcat,  Weblogic) and Messaging solutions (IBM MQ,  Rabbit MQ)     - Provide level 2 and 3 production support for Middleware components and applications     - Lead problem resolution and improvement efforts     - Drive constant interaction with application support,  developers,  and other infrastructure teams.       - Enhance Middleware and Integration operating procedures to make a difference on a global or local scale    - Automate day to day tasks using Shell Scripts/Python,  Ansible,  Jenkins,  Chef or other DevOps Automation tools.     - Handle escalations during IN/UK hours          Essential Functions        The Skills You Bring  :        Energy and Experience  : A growth mindset that is curious and passionate about technologies and enjoys challenging assignments at a global level.       Challenge the Status Quo  : Comfort in pushing the boundaries,   hacking  beyond traditional solutions.       Language Expertise  : Knowledge of Shell Scripts is a must and ability to code in Python is a Plus.       Builder  : Experience building and deploying modern services and web applications with quality and scalability      Learner  : Constant drive to learn new technologies such as Hadoop,  Kafka,  Kubernetes,  Docker,  Chef etc.       Partnership  : Experience collaborating with Product and Support Teams.       **We do not expect that any single candidate would fulfill all these characteristics.  For instance,  we have awesome team members who are really focused on building scalable systems but didn t work with payments technology or web applications before joining Visa.     This is a hybrid position.  Hybrid employees can alternate time between both remote and office.  Employees in hybrid roles are expected to work from the office 2-3 set days a week (determined by leadership/site),  with a general guidepost of being in the office 50% or more of the time based on business needs.
column11: Automation, Appliation, Linux, Weblogi, Perl, Prodution, Windows, Troubleshooting, Python, Performane tuning

column2: Essenware Private Limted is looking for Network Lead to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey     A Network Lead, also known as a Network Manager or Network Administrator, is a professional who oversees the design, implementation, and maintenance of an organization's computer networks     They are responsible for managing the network infrastructure, ensuring its security, and optimizing its performance to meet the organization's requirements     Here are some key responsibilities of a Network Lead:Network Design and Architecture: Developing and maintaining the overall design and architecture of the organization's computer network     The Network Lead works closely with stakeholders to understand business needs, assess network requirements, and design scalable and efficient network solutions     Network Implementation and Configuration: Implementing and configuring network devices, such as routers, switches, firewalls, and load balancers     The Network Lead ensures that network components are properly installed, connected, and configured to support reliable and secure communication     Network Security: Implementing and maintaining network security measures to protect against unauthorized access, data breaches, and other security threats     The Network Lead establishes security policies, configures firewalls, implements intrusion detection and prevention systems, and conducts regular security audits     Network Monitoring and Performance Optimization: Monitoring network performance, analyzing network traffic, and identifying areas for optimization     The Network Lead utilizes network monitoring tools to proactively detect and resolve network issues, optimize network bandwidth, and ensure optimal network performance     Network Troubleshooting and Support: Investigating and resolving network-related issues reported by users or detected through monitoring systems     The Network Lead troubleshoots network connectivity problems, diagnoses hardware or software issues, and coordinates with vendors or support teams for problem resolution     Network Upgrades and Expansion: Planning and implementing network upgrades and expansions to accommodate the organization's growing needs     The Network Lead assesses capacity requirements, recommends appropriate network infrastructure upgrades, and ensures smooth integration of new network equipment
column11: Wireless, VMware, Network Lead, Cloud, jenkins, Deployment, Management

Design and build DevOps technical solutions for cloud-native, cloud-enabled, and on-prem infrastructure with microservices or traditional application patterns.  Must have skills : Google Cloud DevOps Services Good to have skills : Google Kubernetes Engine Minimum  2  year(s) of experience is required Educational Qualification : Total 15 years of full time education Summary :As a DevOps Architect, you will be responsible for designing and engineering DevOps solutions in complex technology environments. Your typical day will involve assessing, designing, and building DevOps technical solutions for cloud-native, cloud-enabled, and on-prem infrastructure with microservices or traditional application patterns using Google Cloud DevOps Services and Google Kubernetes Engine.  Roles & Responsibilities: Design and engineer DevOps solutions in complex technology environments using Google Cloud DevOps Services and Google Kubernetes Engine. Assess and analyze existing infrastructure and applications to identify areas for improvement and optimization. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and build DevOps technical solutions for cloud-native, cloud-enabled, and on-prem infrastructure with microservices or traditional application patterns. Develop and implement automation processes and tools to streamline the software development lifecycle and improve efficiency. Provide technical guidance and mentorship to team members and stakeholders on DevOps best practices and emerging technologies. Professional & Technical Skills: Must To Have Skills:Experience with Google Cloud DevOps Services. Must To Have Skills:Strong understanding of DevOps best practices and emerging technologies. Good To Have Skills:Experience with Google Kubernetes Engine. Experience with infrastructure as code tools such as Terraform or CloudFormation. Experience with containerization technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes. Experience with continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD) tools such as Jenkins or GitLab. Experience with scripting languages such as Python or Bash. Solid understanding of networking and security concepts in cloud environments. Additional Information: The candidate should have a minimum of 2 years of experience in Google Cloud DevOps Services. The ideal candidate will possess a strong educational background in computer science, information technology, or a related field, along with a proven track record of delivering impactful DevOps solutions. This position is based at our Pune office.

column2: We are seeking a highly skilled Azure Cloud Integration Specialist to join our dynamic team. The successful candidate will be responsible for designing, developing, and implementing cloud integration solutions using Microsoft Azure services. This role requires a strong understanding of cloud architecture, integration patterns, and best practices in Azure cloud services. The ideal candidate will possess excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.              ?       Key Responsibilities:         Design and Implementation:         Design, develop, and implement Azure cloud integration solutions to meet business requirements.     Develop integration workflows using Azure Logic Apps, Azure Functions, and other relevant Azure services.     Ensure solutions are scalable, secure, and compliant with industry standards     Develop workflows using Azure Logic Apps, Azure Functions, and other integration services.     Ensure integration solutions are scalable, secure, and follow best practices.     Develop, secure, and manage APIs using Azure API Management.     Ensure APIs are optimized for performance and scalability.     Utilize Azure Service Bus for reliable message queuing and integration.     Implement event-driven architectures using Azure Event Grid.     Integrate and synchronize data across various systems using Azure Data Factory.     Ensure data consistency and quality across integrated systems.     Monitor integration solutions for performance and reliability.     Troubleshoot     Optimize integration solutions for performance, scalability, and cost-efficiency.     Work closely with developers, architects, and business stakeholders to design effective integration solutions.     Provide technical guidance and support to team members.     Document integration processes, workflows, and best practices.     Ensure all integration solutions adhere to security standards and compliance requirements.     Implement and maintain security best practices in all integration workflows.             Qualifications:         Education and Experience:         bachelors degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.     4+ years of experience in cloud integration, specifically with Microsoft Azure.         Strong experience with Azure services like API Management, Logic Apps, Service Bus, Event Grid, and Data Factory.     Proficiency in programming/scripting languages such as C#, Python, or JavaScript.     Experience with RESTful APIs, SOAP, and other integration protocols.     Familiarity with DevOps practices and tools such as Azure DevOps, CI/CD pipelines, and version control systems like Git.     Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.     Strong communication and interpersonal skills.     Ability to work independently and as part of a team.     Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.     Microsoft Certified: Azure Solutions Architect Expert or Azure Developer Associate.     Experience with other cloud platforms such as AWS or Google Cloud.     Knowledge of containerization and orchestration tools like Docker and Kubernetes.         Benefits            Exciting Projects:    We focus on industries like High-Tech, communication, media, healthcare, retail and telecom. Our customer list is full of fantastic global brands and leaders who love what we build for them.       Collaborative Environment:    You Can expand your skills by collaborating with a diverse team of highly talented people in an open, laidback environment or even abroad in one of our global centres.       Work-Life Balance:    Accellor prioritizes work-life balance, which is why we offer flexible work schedules, opportunities to work from home, and paid time off and holidays.       Professional Development:    Our dedicated Learning & Development team regularly organizes Communication skills training, Stress Management program, professional certifications, and technical and soft skill trainings.       Excellent Benefits:    We provide our employees with competitive salaries, family medical insurance, Personal Accident Insurance, Periodic health awareness program, extended maternity leave, annual performance bonuses, and referral bonuses

column2: This is a full-time role as a GCP Infrastructure Lead at Datametica. The    Infrastructure Lead will be responsible for overseeing the design and    implementation of GCP infrastructure solutions, providing guidance on Cloud    Infrastructure Architecture, Cloud Network Architecture design &    implementation, and ensuring the scalability, reliability, security, logging &    monitoring of the cloud environment. The role involves collaborating with    cross-functional teams, conducting infrastructure assessments, analyzing    requirements, and implementing best practices for cloud infrastructure    management. Some remote work is allowed.       Qualifications, Required Skills and Abilities       * Bachelors or Masters degree in Computer Science or a related field   * 7 plus years of demonstrated relevant experience deploying, configuring and    supporting GCP cloud Infrastructure - IaaS and PaaS   * Experience in configuring and managing the GCP infrastructure environment    components   * Hands-on experience in at least two or more disciplines : GKE migration,    GCVE migration, CloudBuild & Cloud Run, VM migration to GCE   * Foundation components - Networking ( VPN, Firewall and Routes), IAM, Folder    Structure, Org Policy, Advanced Security etc.   * Application Components - Database, Data Warehouse, Scheduling Services,    Storage, Kubernetes, VMs etc.   * Operational Components - Audit Logs, Monitoring, Alerts, Billing Exports    etc.   * Security Components - KMS, Secrets Management etc.   * Experience with Infrastructure Automation using Terraform, Cloud Formation,    etc.   * Experience in designing and implementing CI/CD pipelines with Cloud Build,    Jenkins, Azure Devops, Bitbucket Pipelines etc. & Source Code Management tools like GIT   * Experience with scripting - Shell Scripting and Python   * Knowledge of GCP services and architecture   * Experience with infrastructure assessments and analysis   * Understanding of cloud security best practices   * Excellent problem-solving and troubleshooting skills   * Strong communication and collaboration skills   * Relevant certifications in GCP cloud infrastructure is a plus   * Good verbal and written communication skills   * Strong Team Player       In Short       * Mandatory Skills - Networking (VPC, Firewall, Routes & VPN), Cloud    Security, Terraform, Shell/Python Scripting   * Secondary Skills - IAAS & PAAS Services, CI/CD Pipelines, Cloud logging & monitoring   * Good To Have - Certifications in GCP (Cloud DevOps / Cloud Security / Cloud Networking)

Roles & Responsibilities: Over 5 years of hands-on experience in application security.Advanced proficiency in tackling technical challenges independently.Good understanding of AWS cloud technologies and environments.Familiarity and experience with tools like Snyk, Veracode,Gitleaks and Burp Suite will be an added advantage.Strong knowledge of web application frameworks (such as OWASP) and CI/CD frameworks.Experience with scripting languages (e.g., Python, JavaScript, PowerShell, Ruby, PHP) to develop custom scripts.Familiarity with shift-left tools and application security workflows.Excellent collaboration skills to work with cross-functional teams towards shared goals. Excellent written and verbal communication skills.Bachelor's degree in information technology, Computer Science, or equivalent practical experience. Professional & Technical Skills: SAST and DAST Testing:Perform Static Application Security Testing (SAST) and Dynamic Application Security Testing (DAST), review their outputs, and assist the development team with remediation strategies.GitHub Security:Configure and manage security tools such as Snyk and leverage GitHub's native security features to scan for vulnerabilities in the codebase and dependencies.CI/CD Pipeline Security:Ensure integration of security scans within our CI/CD pipelines to identify vulnerabilities early in the development process.Container Security:Implement and enforce security best practices for containerization within AWS ECS and ECR environments, focusing on secure configurations, image scanning, and robust access control measures.Vulnerability Management:Lead the coordination and management of vulnerability scanning and remediation efforts across the application stack, encompassing the codebase, containers, and AWS infrastructure.Penetration Testing:Conduct thorough penetration testing on products and systems, including web applications and services, to identify and exploit security flaws.Cross-functional Collaboration:Participate in triage calls with cross-functional teams and effectively communicate vulnerability details, risks, and potential impacts to stakeholders Additional Information: The candidate should have a minimum of 5 years of experience in Static Application Security Testing (SAST). The ideal candidate will possess a strong educational background in computer science, information technology, or a related field, along with a proven track record of delivering impactful security solutions. This position is based at our Gurugram office. Qualification Bachelor or college degree in related field or equivalent work experience

column2: IDP are looking for DevOps Architect who want to do important work, with a totally modern tech stack, in an environment where we are constantly improving our Software Engineering, and importantly we deliver high quality software each sprint.           RESPONSIBILITIES             My passion for always improving is contagious. I know software development is a team sport, and I think of myself as a sort of software coach. My credibility helps people move forward in their software engineering journey.     I plan the Work and work the Plan. I like having a plan for where we want to take Software Engineering and roll-up my sleeves to do the hard work to make it so.     Modern Software Engineering is my passion. I really love all aspects of improving the way Software is engineered, delivered, and operated. Lots of people talk about DevSecOps, CI/CD, Shift Left, SAST, DAST - I know when the right time is to move ahead with each of these for a given team, and how to achieve the outcome, not just the buzzword.     Senior Leaders Trust me. I m confident enough to talk truth to power. Leaders know I don t exaggerate, distort or cover-up news.     I make things better: I get great joy from helping teams move along the DevSecOps maturity curve. After spending a short amount of time with a team, I understand where they are at in their maturity journey and help them plot their course. I love working closely with Software Engineers to break through any concerns they may have in adopting new approaches.     People ask for me by name. I have a reputation as someone that people pull in when there is a tough problem to solve. Software Engineers, Developers, Security teams all ask for me to be involved in their initiatives - they know I make a difference.         WHAT WERE LOOKING FOR         Vision. We are ambitious about our goals for DevSecOps and Modern Software Engineering. It is our belief that accelerating our adoption of the cultures and behaviors associated with these practices is even more important than the industry leading tools that we have available to us.     Leadership. Change can be hard, but the right leadership can make it easier. Embedding new behaviors and approaches needs a plan, a leader and lots of hard work. We need you to be a person who is motivational, clear in expectations, supportive, driven, and able to cut through blockers and distractions. Your super-power is to leave teams you ve helped improve be excited about the next step in their journey because they know they are growing and increasing their own impact.     Accelerated Outcomes. We are determined to accelerate the speed we deliver high quality features. A well-paced energetic drive, that results in Outcomes, is part of your DNA.     Automation Powerhouse. You know what can, and should, be automated in Software Engineering and Delivery. You will have practical experience tools like Jira, Git, Gitlab, Docker, SonarQube, Pytest, Junit, Jest, Selenium, ReadyAPI, X-ray, Splunk, Sumologic, Snyk     Metrics and Measurement. Across our business we use data to understand how we re performing. You ll be smart about using data to drive adoption and measure progress.     Innovator and Thought Leader. IDP are always looking to improve. We value Software experts who float ideas, improve our standards, share knowledge - you will have a history of these sorts of things.     Serverless IaC. With few exceptions IDP utilize AWS Serverless services which continues to give us fantastic flexibility to deliver business features. You will have practical experience with the most common AWS serverless services (Lambda, API Gateway, SQS, SNS) or their Azure/GCP equivalents. We do all our provisioning using IaC and are currently migrating over to AWS CDK from Terraform.
column11: Career development, Architect, Automation, GIT, GCP, devops, Agile, splunk, Selenium, JIRA

column2: Position Overview:  We're seeking an experienced Automation Architect to lead the design and implementation of automation solutions across our organization. The ideal candidate will possess a strong background in automation, proficient in scripting languages like Python, and adept at infrastructure automation with Ansible. Key Responsibilities: Lead the development and implementation of automation strategies, frameworks, and best practices to streamline processes and enhance efficiency. Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business requirements, technical objectives, and automation needs, crafting comprehensive solutions to address them. Design scalable, modular, and reusable automation architectures supporting the automation of various processes, workflows, and systems. Develop scripts, templates, and tools for automation using Python, Ansible, or similar technologies. Evaluate and recommend automation tools, technologies, and platforms based on business requirements and industry best practices. Define standards, guidelines, and governance mechanisms for automation development, deployment, and maintenance. Provide technical leadership and guidance to automation engineers and cross-functional teams throughout the automation lifecycle. Collaborate with infrastructure, development, and operations teams to integrate automation solutions with existing systems and tools. Stay current with emerging automation technologies, tools, and best practices, sharing knowledge with the team through training and presentations. Required Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field. Proven experience as an Automation Engineer, DevOps Engineer, or similar role. Strong proficiency in scripting and programming languages such as Python. Extensive experience with infrastructure automation using Ansible. Solid understanding of infrastructure architecture, cloud computing concepts, and deployment pipelines. Excellent problem-solving and decision-making abilities, with a focus on delivering practical, scalable automation solutions. Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to interact effectively with stakeholders at all levels. Nice-to-Have Qualifications: Certification in relevant technologies (e.g., AWS Certified DevOps Engineer, Ansible Automation). Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud Platform. Knowledge of containerization technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes. Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and related tools. Previous experience in the [industry/sector] sector or related industries.

column2: DESCRIPTION:  We are looking for an engineer who is passionate about AWS Cloud technology, passionate about helping customers succeed, passionate about quality and truly enjoys what they do. The qualified candidate for AWS Cloud Engineer position is someone who has a can-do attitude and is an innovative thinker.? ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:? Understand clients infrastructure and various applications running on the servers. Write, Review, and Approve Automation and Infrastructure code. Work with Project teams to build automation pipelines for application environment deployments Brainstorm for new ideas and ways to improve development delivery.  Able to present and communicate the architecture in a visual form.  Evaluate potential single-points of failure within the Cloud infrastructure; Recommend risk mitigation next steps to build out a high availability solution.  Apply experience, technical knowledge and innovative techniques to resolve complex Operations challenges.? column2: Your Role and Responsibilities The mainframe technology is one of the most reliable in the World. Now in the Cloud era IBM offers modernization of the applications for the hybrid clouds, leveraging a marriage stability of mainframe with accessibility of the cloud. Have you ever thought about assisting IT development teams to fight disruption and innovate faster, using agile practices to deliver hybrid applications via an automated pipeline? As a #DevOps zSolutions Delivery Consultant, you will learn and experience how we apply technical expertise to ensure world-class delivery using consultative skills such as problem-solving hypothesis-based methodologies, communication, and service orientation skills. As a member of IBM Technology Expert Labs, Global Delivery Center #GDC you will be client focused, courageous, pragmatic, and technical to optimize and trailblaze new solutions that address real business challenges. To help achieve this win-win outcome, a 'day-in-the-life' in this role may include, but not be limited to Working under general supervision you will be understanding clients' main challenges and developing solutions that help them transform mission-critical IBM Z applications for hybrid cloud environments with stability, security, and agility. Participating in planning, installing, configuring, verifying, and migrating IBM Z DevOps solutions that uses robust toolsets to develop and maintain z/OS applications.  Ensuring accurate documentation of and delivery to the project scope and timeline alongside adherence to the zDevOps products' implementation methodologies. Demonstrating a natural bias towards self-motivation, curiosity, and initiative in addition to navigating data and people to find answers and present solutions. Strong collaboration and communication skills as you work across the client, partner, and IBM team. Participating in technical solution workshops. Joining the IBM Technology Expert Labs teams means you'll have a career delivering world-class services for our clients. As the ultimate expert in IBM products, you'll bring together all the necessary technology and services to help customers solve their most challenging problems. Working in IBM Technology Expert Labs means accelerating the time to value confidently and ensuring speed and insight while our clients focus on what they do best-running and growing their business.  Excellent onboarding and industry-leading learning culture will set you up for a positive impact, while advancing your career. Our culture is collaborative and experiential. As part of a team, you will be surrounded by bright minds and keen co-creators-always willing to help and be helped-as you apply passion to work that will positively impact the world around us. Required Technical and Professional Expertise BE/BTech in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent experience in Computer Science/Information Systems/Engineering. Hands-on exposure to real-world application of computer science, information systems or engineering concepts Excellent communication and presentation skills that are engaging, compelling, and influential. Experience with the design, deployment, and optimization of software solutions for IBM Z, LinuxONE and associated operating systems and virtualization software including z/OS or Linux. Technical Expertise in Mainframe System Software on z/OS, including deployment of software solutions for IBM Z, LinuxONE and associated operating systems and virtualization software including z/OS or Linux on Z. Technical Expertise in Mainframe System Software on z/OS, middleware, and networking, including integrations between Z DevOps products and open source or third-party offerings. Technical Expertise with automation, containerization, orchestration, monitoring, analytics, and visualization DevOps tools. Technical experience with COBOL and JAVA coding Experience in the preparation and delivery of training Ability to work independently and take accountability. 5+ years of experience with IBM Z  5+ years of solution consulting or relevant industry experience. Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise Experience with installation and configuration of IBM Z products, customization and application integration and testing and validation of success criteria. Experience with Git migrations. Experience with flexible infrastructure implementation, including development and testing for cloud native app development and modernization in a flexible consumption model. Experience with the following products will be highly regarded: Developer for z/OS (IDz), Enterprise Edition (IDzEE), Application Delivery Foundation for z/OS (ADFz), Application Discovery and Delivery Intelligence (ADDI), IBM Z Development and Test (ZD&T) and IBM Virtual Dev and Test for z/OS (ZVDT) Experience with the following products will be highly regarded: GitLab, Git, AWS, Docker, Chef, Ansible, Kubernetes, Graylog, Grafana, Jenkins, OpenStack, Azure, Gradle, VS Code Experience with CI/CD Experience in the delivery of training. In addition to the above experience, the ideal candidate will have exceptional interpersonal and communication skills. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with excellent attention to detail. Dynamic team player who is comfortable working in a small, but rapidly evolving environment.

column2: Software Developers at IBM are the backbone of our strategic initiatives to design, code, test, and provide industry-leading solutions that make the world run today - planes and trains take off on time, bank transactions complete in the blink of an eye and the world remains safe because of the work our software developers do. Whether you are working on projects internally or for a client, software development is critical to the success of IBM and our clients worldwide. At IBM, you will use the latest software development tools, techniques and approaches and work with leading minds in the industry to build solutions you can be proud of. Your Role and Responsibilities As part of Technology Expert Labs - Global Delivery Center (TEL - GDC) and Maximo Practice - Center of Excellence (CoE), you will have the opportunity to be part of a team of IBM Delivery Consultants and Subject Matter Experts delivering expert services to customers and partners across markets on IBM Software solutions and use cases. As a Maximo Consultant, you will be preparing Maximo Technical & Functional Specifications based on client business requirements. You will work closely with client teams, subject matter experts and key stakeholders from multiple business areas (like Product, Offering Management) in providing expert technical guidance for Maximo solutioning, Estimation, design and implementation. Required Technical and Professional Expertise Minimum 12 years of strong hands on Maximo experience Professional and Technical Expertise: Working experience on one or more of IBM MAS Offerings (MAS Manage, Monitor, Health, Predict, MVI, Mobile) Experience in MAS Migration Working experience on RHOCP Agile Methodology Required Professional and Technical Expertise: IBM MAS 8.x or IBM Maximo Certified Deployment Consultant (V7.6 and/or V7.5) Experience of solution design, deployment within Enterprise Asset Management (EAM) domain Programming: API design, Java, Python, Object-Oriented Programming Database: DB2, NoSQL Scripting: Perl User Interface: HTML, CSS, Javascript, Graphite, AngularJS/React Cloud Deployment: Cloud Foundry, Docker, Kubernetes Operating System: Knowledge of UNIX/Linux platforms Deep understanding and experience across SDLC Presentation skills - should be able to present ideas/solutions with clarity to team Team Player- Show flexibility to work across technologies/platforms Ownership- Own tasks and outcome Leadership - Lead and inspire the team General skills Excellent analytical, problem solving, articulation, client-handling skills coupled with project/ team leading abilities Good communication skills - being proactive about weekly status, update on issues or defects Prepare and provide client presentations including demos as per project requirement Possess innovative mindset. Keen to explore, learn new things and share/apply them to solve problems Works well with team Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise Knowledge of below IBM Sterling Data Exchange products: IBM Sterling Connect:Direct (CD) IBM Sterling Control Center Director (CCD) IBM Sterling Global Mailbox (GM) IBM Sterling Partner Engagement Manager (PEM) IBM Transformation Extender/ Advanced (ITX/ ITXA) Sound knowledge and familiarity with:  Cloud (AWS/Azure/GCP/OCI/IBM Cloud) Containerization (Docker & Kubernetes)  AI-ML, Generative AI (LLM) and Python DevOps, CI/CD toolchain  Open Source software/ tools (Kakfa, Elastic Search, Kibana etc)

Experienced in Redis for efficient caching and improving data retrieval performance for applications. Experienced in DBT or PySpark for managing the transformation and modeling of data in the data pipelines. Strong proficiency in Python for scripting, data manipulation, and general programming tasks. Experience in both Lambda and Kappa architectures for real-time and batch processing in big data systems.

column2: Azure Services Knowledge: Deep understanding of Azure services such as Azure Virtual Machines, Azure Active Directory, Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS), Azure SQL Database, and others.     Networking: Knowledge of Azure networking services like Azure Virtual Network, VPN Gateway, Azure ExpressRoute, and an understanding of networking concepts (DNS, TCP/IP, HTTP, VPNs, etc.).     Security and Compliance: Familiarity with Azure security tools such as Azure Security Center, Azure Firewall, and knowledge of compliance standards relevant to cloud services (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA, ISO 27001).     Cloud Architecture Design: Ability to design scalable, highly available, and fault-tolerant systems on Azure.     Best Practices: Knowledge of best practices for cloud architecture, leveraging Microsofts Cloud Adoption Framework (CAF) and Well-Architected Framework.     CI/CD Pipelines: Understanding of continuous integration and continuous deployment methodologies using Azure DevOps or GitHub Actions.     Monitoring and Management: Experience with monitoring tools such as Azure Monitor and Azure Log Analytics, and management tools like Azure Automation and Azure Cost Management.     Disaster Recovery and Backup: Familiarity with Azure Site Recovery and Azure Backup for implementing disaster recovery strategies and ensuring data durability.

column1: Hiring For AWS Architect (Data Engineer) _ Immediate Joiner
column2: Hiring For AWS Architect (Data Engineer) _ Immediate Joiner  Immediate Joiner  Location : Chennai or Bangalore    Qualifications:   Proven experience as an AWS Architect with expertise in AWS Lambda, AWS Glue, data lakes, S3, and API integrations.? Experience in Data lake handling, Data Processing, performance, cost optimization Strong proficiency in .NET development, particularly .NET Core. or Java Development Experience in data integration, mapping, and workflow design for diverse data sources.? Familiarity with SQL servers and hands-on experience in optimizing data workflows.? Knowledge of data archiving, retention, and governance principles.? In-depth understanding of security best practices and compliance considerations in data architectures.? Proficiency in programming languages commonly used in AWS environments (e.g., Python, Node.js).? AWS certifications, such as AWS Certified Solutions Architect, are a plus.? Architectural Design:   Design and implement scalable, reliable, and cost-effective solutions on AWS, focusing on serverless architectures.? Develop AWS Lambda functions using .NET Core for efficient and event-driven computing.? Data Integration and Mapping:   Architect and implement robust data integration solutions using AWS Glue, emphasizing the seamless integration of various data sources through RESTful APIs.? Design and implement data mapping strategies to ensure accurate and efficient data transformation.? Data Lake Implementation:   Lead the design and implementation of AWS-based data lake solutions, utilizing Amazon S3 for scalable and secure storage.? Implement data archiving and retention strategies within the data lake environment.? S3 Storage Management:   Design and implement effective strategies for data storage, retrieval, and archival using Amazon S3.? Optimize S3 configurations for high performance, cost efficiency, and data durability.? Integration with SQL Servers:   Architect solutions for seamless integration with SQL servers, ensuring efficient data extraction, transformation, and loading processes.? Design and optimize data workflows between AWS services and SQL databases.? Email Attachment Handling:   Architect solutions for handling and processing email attachments within the AWS environment, incorporating .NET Core components.? Implement secure and efficient mechanisms for extracting, storing, and processing email attachments.? Data Governance:   Define and enforce data governance policies, ensuring compliance with industry standards and regulations.? Implement measures for data quality, integrity, and security across the AWS ecosystem.? .NET Development Support:   Provide expertise in .NET development to support and enhance AWS Lambda functions and other serverless components.? Collaborate with development teams to ensure seamless integration of AWS services with .NET applications.? Data Archiving and Retention:   Design and implement strategies for data archiving and retention, considering regulatory requirements and business needs.? Ensure the proper management of historical data and facilitate efficient data retrieval as needed.? column2: Overview As a key member of the Cloud Engineering team, you are part of a team responsible for ensuring availability, reliability, responsiveness, and scalability across all ZL client Production services. You are deeply hands-on with our cloud-based infrastructure, automation, monitoring and systems telemetry.   You work with our engineering team to design and build system infrastructure that is automated, elastic, and reliable. The tools you build and provide increase automation, consistency, and confidence in all platforms. In a team member, we expect you to challenge conventional wisdom and encourage everyone to have simpler solutions. You are a team member that is interested in the products we work on and have a passion for making the Internet a safer place.   Ideal candidates have a background or immense interest in working with: Ansible, Azure, AWS, Tomcat/Java, RabbitMQ, Kafka, MySQL, CloudFormation, Terraform, Kubernetes and Restful API development. Please include a link to your Github or BitBucket account, as well as any links to some of your projects if available.     Role & responsibilities        Ability to harness all that Azure/AWS has to offer - you'll be spinning up new scalable environments quickly and keeping our cloud accounts tidy and efficient.  A high degree of familiarity with Linux containers and container orchestration tools like Kubernetes  Strong understanding of HTTP, REST, networking concepts and global load-balancing  A passion towards automation  a key team goal is to reduce daily toil through automation  Work cross-functionally within a service team and be a core contributor in every significant engineering solution that is delivered  Debug production issues across services and levels of the stack  Participate in on-call rotations, along with every member of the engineering team  Solid understanding of system design, including the operational trade-offs of various designs  Solid programming and troubleshooting skills. You wont be expected to know everything, but we are looking for people who can dig through a codebase for debugging and commit tactical fixes as needed. Preferred candidate profile     Skills/Qualifications  You have 8+ years in technology with at least three in a Cloud Engineer  Youre a storyteller with compelling stories about that time you learned something new to solve a problem for your company, and stories about the times you helped your team members skill up.  You have powerful stories about the failures and mistakes youve made, and the lessons learned. You share them as cautionary tales with your team members.  You love to code and deploy at scale.  You have a desire to make the Internet a safer place.  You had a passion for tools like Ansible and Cloud-formation, but are moving on to tools like Terraform, Kubernetes and Helm.  You approach problems from a product perspective, thinking through how the user will interact with what you're building.  You have strong communication skills. You ask questions, let others know when you need help, and tell others what you need. You write things down so someone else on your team can do them.  You're a problem solver. You believe the best work is the result of finding the simplest solution to complex challenges. We see simplicity as the greatest expression of intelligence and responsibility.  You see the big picture. You understand how the code you write interacts with systems and services, both internally and externally. Perks and benefits   As per Marketing and Industry. Group Medical benefits,Personal accident, PF, etc

column2: Project Role : Application Lead Project Role Description : Lead the effort to design, build and configure applications, acting as the primary point of contact.  Must have skills : DevOps Good to have skills : Node.js, Infrastructure as Code (IaC), Docker Kubernetes Administration Minimum  7.5  year(s) of experience is required Educational Qualification : NA Summary :As a DevOps Application Lead, you will be responsible for leading the effort to design, build, and configure applications, acting as the primary point of contact. Your typical day will involve working with Node.js, Docker Kubernetes Administration, and Infrastructure as Code (IaC) to ensure seamless application deployment and management.  Roles & Responsibilities: Lead the design, build, and configuration of applications, ensuring seamless deployment and management using DevOps tools and techniques. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure the timely delivery of high-quality software products, leveraging Agile methodologies and DevOps best practices. Develop and maintain automated deployment pipelines, utilizing tools like Jenkins, GitLab, and Ansible for continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD). Professional & Technical Skills: Must To Have Skills:Strong experience in DevOps methodologies and tools, including Jenkins, GitLab, Ansible, Terraform, and CloudFormation. Good To Have Skills:Experience with Node.js, Docker Kubernetes Administration, and Infrastructure as Code (IaC). Expertise in Agile methodologies and DevOps best practices, including continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD). Strong understanding of cloud computing platforms like AWS, Azure, and GCP, including experience with cloud-native services like Lambda, EC2, S3, and RDS. Experience with monitoring and logging tools like ELK, Prometheus, and Grafana, ensuring the observability and performance of the application infrastructure. Solid grasp of scripting languages like Python, Bash, and PowerShell, automating routine tasks and improving operational efficiency. Additional Information: The candidate should have a minimum of 7.5 years of experience in DevOps methodologies and tools. The ideal candidate will possess a strong educational background in computer science, software engineering, or a related field, along with a proven track record of delivering impactful DevOps solutions. This position is based at our Bengaluru office. Qualification NA

column2: Your Role and Responsibilities The IBM Technology Expert Labs organization is looking for an IBM Geographically Dispersed Parallel Sysplex (IBM GDPS) Delivery Consultant with expertise in IBM Z, zOS and Storage technology and products to lead and deliver pre-sales and post-sales client engagements that enable the adoption of IBM GDPS.  Ideal candidates will have demonstrated a successful history of implementing IBM GDPS engagements, be familiar with sysplex architectural methods, can independently assess IT infrastructures, evaluate gaps in best practices and create IBM GDPS solution recommendations for client environments while displaying excellent collaboration and communication with Clients, Sellers, Business Partners and Colleagues by delivering reports to clients. You will be responsible for developing and delivering IBM GDPS solution design, architecture, and implementation of IBM GDPS solutions which may include:  #ISATSELQ224 Required Technical and Professional Expertise 3+ years' experience working with:  z/OS High Availability technology and capabilities including Parallel Sysplex (eg: GRS, Coupling Facilities and Sysplex Failure Management) z/VM system programming or Linux on z Systems administration  Copy Services technology including Metro Mirror, Global Mirror and z/OS Global Mirror (plus FlashCopy Software replication  Successfully delivering IBM Z projects and/or architecting and planning infrastructures for customer's data centers 3+ years' experience in: Customer or executive facing communications, requirements analysis, documentation, and report presentations. Networking skills especially TCP/IP knowledge Tivoli System Automation and/or NetView Storage management experience using DFSMS Ability to lead customer technical workshops up to 20+ people. Strong written and verbal communication skills English: Fluent Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise Familiarity with installation and configuration of IBM Z products. Familiarity with Git migrations. Familiarity with the following products will be highly regarded: Developer for z/OS (IDz), Enterprise Edition (IDzEE), Application Delivery Foundation for z/OS (ADFz), Application Discovery and Delivery Intelligence (ADDI), IBM Z Development and Test (ZD&T) and IBM Virtual Dev and Test for z/OS (ZVDT) Exposure to CI/CD Technical expertise with COBOL and JAVA coding  Experience with delivery of training. In addition to the above experience, the ideal candidate will have exceptional interpersonal and communication skills. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with excellent attention to detail. Dynamic team player who is comfortable working in a small, but rapidly evolving environment. A passion for making a difference in their profession and the environment

column2: The Senior Lab Developer Lead at KodeKloud plays a crucial role in creating and overseeing the development of lab-specific content, focusing on current trends in DevOps, Cloud Native technologies, and emerging tech such as AIOps and MLOps     This position requires a blend of technical expertise, strategic thinking, leadership skills, and client interaction to drive the creation of engaging and relevant content for our learners and support our B2B partnerships               Key Responsibilities:         1. Content Strategy and Development       - Identify and explore new opportunities to create labs around current trends in DevOps, Cloud Native technologies, and emerging tech such as AIOps, MLOps, etc.   - Collaborate with the Content team and the CTO to prioritize and execute long-overdue tasks, including creating new mock exams for the CKS course, enhancing existing mock exams, and developing cloud-based challenges and similar courses.   - Contribute to the ideation and development of new labs by working closely with the KodeKloud Engineer and engineering teams.     ?     2. Team Leadership and Management       - Provide technical leadership to the team of lab developers at KodeKloud.   - Facilitate task prioritization and conduct weekly meetings with the team to understand challenges and issues and explore ideas internally.   - Work with the content and engineering teams to resolve any challenges or issues the lab development team faces.   - Delegate tasks to lab developers, ensuring accountability for the timely release of high-quality content.   - Oversee projects from start to finish, ensuring they meet the desired quality standards and are delivered within the agreed-upon timelines.     ?     3. Hands-on Development       - Actively participate in developing lab content, leveraging your technical expertise to create engaging and informative labs.   - Ensure the technical accuracy, relevance, and quality of the content created by the lab development team.   - Stay current with industry trends and technologies to ensure the content remains current and valuable to learners.     ?     4. Collaboration and Communication       - Foster a collaborative and inclusive environment within the lab development team, encouraging open communication and knowledge sharing.   - Communicate effectively with cross-functional teams, including Content, Engineering, and KodeKloud Engineer teams, to align priorities and ensure seamless project execution.   - Provide regular updates to stakeholders on the progress of lab development initiatives and any challenges or roadblocks encountered.     ?     5. External Engagement       - Participate in calls with external trainers to ideate opportunities for adding labs to the courses they are working on, ensuring alignment with their learning objectives and KodeKlouds content strategy.   - Conduct demos of the KodeKloud platform for B2B clients, showcasing the wide variety of labs available and highlighting how the hands-on learning approach can help organizations upskill their teams in DevOps and cloud-native technologies.   - Gather feedback and insights from external trainers and B2B clients to continuously improve the lab content and the overall learning experience.     ?           Required Skills and Experience:         - Minimum 5 years experience in Linux Systems Administration   - Minimum 3 years of professional experience working with at least one cloud platform (AWS, Azure, or GCP)   - Professional working experience with DevOps tools like Docker, Kubernetes, Ansible, Packer, Vagrant, and Terraform   - Experience automating tasks with Python, Shell Scripting, and JSON queries.   - Proficiency in using SDK for the above-mentioned cloud technologies, CLI, Infrastructure as Code (IaC), and configuration management   - Excellent written and verbal communication skills   - Strong leadership and project management abilities   - Ability to think strategically and translate ideas into actionable plans   - Passion for creating high-quality educational content and helping others learn and grow   - Comfort with client-facing interactions and the ability to effectively demonstrate the value of KodeKlouds offerings     Preferred Qualifications:   - Bachelors or Masters degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field   - Relevant certifications in DevOps, Cloud, or related technologies would be a bonus   - Experience in creating online learning content or tutorials   - Proven track record of leading and mentoring technical teams             This is an exciting opportunity for a seasoned technical professional to significantly impact the future of DevOps and cloud education, both through the creation of exceptional content and by engaging with external trainers and B2B clients       If you are passionate about creating content that empowers learners, have a strong background in the required technologies, and enjoy collaborating with others to drive success, wed love to hear from you!
